content.title: Scheme of Extending Grants for the Publication of Rare Books on Arts
content.details: The 'Scheme for Giving Awards to Traditional Artists' was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, the grant is sanctioned to the writer for the publication of books that are considered rare for the development of arts. 60% of the total cost of the printing charges of 1000 copies or ₹15,000/- whichever is less is sanctioned as a grant. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Manram.
benefits: 60% of the total cost of the printing charges of 1000 copies or ₹15,000/- whichever is less is sanctioned as a grant.
First Installment: 50% upon selection of the book by the Expert Committee.
Second Installment: 50% after the author submits 100 printed copies of the book along with an expenditure statement for verification.
eligibility: The applicant should be an Author/Writer.
The applicant should lack sufficient financial resources to cover the publishing expenses of the rare books.
The book should have been considered rare for the development of arts.
The submitted book should not have been published before.
exclusions: This grant is not given for reprint.
content.application_process: Offline. The advertisement is published in the newspapers, calling for applications by the Tamil Nadu Eyal Isai Nataka Mandram. Interested applicants should visit the office Mandram and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the concerned staff.
documents_required: 3 Copies manuscript of the book to be published.
Quotations for printing (from three printing presses).

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for the publication grant?
faqs.answer: Eligibility criteria include submitting a rare book on arts, demonstrating financial need, and adhering to application procedures outlined by the implementing institution.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the Scheme of Grants for Rare Books on Arts?
faqs.answer: Applicants must submit their applications to the Tamil Nadu Eyal Isai Nataka Mandram along with the manuscript and quotations for printing as per the advertised procedure.

faqs.question: Who implements the publication grant scheme?
faqs.answer: The publication grant scheme is implemented by the Tamil Nadu Eyal Isai Nataka Mandram.

faqs.question: What is the maximum grant amount available?
faqs.answer: The grant covers 60% of the total printing charges for 1000 copies or ₹15,000, whichever is less.

faqs.question: Can I apply if my book has already been published?
faqs.answer: No, the grant is not applicable to books that have already been published.

faqs.question: How many copies of the manuscript should I submit with my application?
faqs.answer: Applicants should submit three copies of the manuscript along with their application.

faqs.question: Are there any specific requirements for the manuscript?
faqs.answer: The manuscript should be relevant to the arts and considered rare, meeting the criteria outlined in the advertisement.

faqs.question: How will the Expert Committee select books for the grant?
faqs.answer: The Expert Committee will scrutinize submitted manuscripts and select books based on their rarity and contribution to the development of arts.

faqs.question: What expenses are covered by the grant?
faqs.answer: The grant covers 60% of the total printing charges for 1000 copies or ₹15,000, whichever is less, for the publication of rare books on arts.

faqs.question: Can I submit quotations from printing presses outside of Tamil Nadu?
faqs.answer: Yes, as long as the quotations meet the requirements outlined in the application procedure.

faqs.question: Is there a deadline for submitting the application?
faqs.answer: The deadline is typically specified in the advertisement published by the Tamil Nadu Eyal Isai Nataka Mandram.

faqs.question: Can the grant be used for digital publication?
faqs.answer: The scheme is primarily focused on the publication of physical books, but digital publication may be considered if it aligns with the scheme's objectives.

faqs.question: Is there an age limit for applicants?
faqs.answer: There is typically no specified age limit for applicants, but they must meet the eligibility criteria outlined in the advertisement.

faqs.question: Can the grant cover the cost of illustrations or images in the book?
faqs.answer: Yes, if these expenses are included in the total printing charges for the publication of the book.

faqs.question: Are self-published books eligible for the grant?
faqs.answer: Yes, as long as they meet the eligibility criteria and have not been previously published.
